meanings.definition: A claim made in support of another claim.
meanings.sent1: In the debate, she presented a subclaim to back up her main argument.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer's subclaim helped strengthen his case in court.
meanings.sent3: The subclaim about the benefits of exercise made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her subclaim was like a small puzzle piece fitting perfectly into the larger picture.
meanings.sent5: The subclaim about the importance of teamwork was crystal clear to all.

meanings.definition: To assert or maintain a subclaim.
meanings.sent1: He will subclaim his innocence until proven guilty.
meanings.sent2: She subclaims that the data supports her hypothesis.
meanings.sent3: The students subclaim their right to a longer recess with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent4: The team subclaimed victory after a hard-fought match.
meanings.sent5: The chef subclaims that his recipe is the best in town.
